definitions.definition: to make marks that represent letters, words, or numbers on a surface, such as paper or a computer screen, using a pen, pencil, or keyboard, or to use this method to record thoughts, facts, or messages:
examples: When you fill in the form, please write clearly/legibly in black ink.

definitions.definition: to send a letter or message to someone, giving them information or expressing your thoughts or feelings:
examples: She hasn't written to me (US also written me) recently.

definitions.definition: to put all the information that is needed on a document:
examples: Please will you write (out) your name and address in full.

definitions.definition: to create and record something, such as a book, poem, song, or computer program, on paper or on a computer:
to have the job of creating books, stories, or articles that will be published:
examples: She writes for a national newspaper.

definitions.definition: to say something in a book, newspaper, magazine, or document:
examples: In the article, he writes that the problems in the refugee camps are getting worse.

definitions.definition: to record information in the memory of a computer:
examples: There was a problem writing to the disk in the A drive.
